wikipedia_page.main: Florence Beatrice Paton (née Widdowson; 1 June 1891 – 12 October 1976) was a Labour Party politician in the United Kingdom, and a Member of Parliament (MP) from 1945 to 1950.

response: She was nominated by Florence Paton,  Cyril Dumpleton, Cairine Wilson, John Herman Randall, Stanley Knowles, Rudolf Schümperli, John Sturge Stephens, W. J. M. van Eysinga, Lucy Noel-Buxton, Judah Leon Magnes, Agnus MacInnis, Lucas Middleton and sixteen Finnish law professors and MPs.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1945 United Kingdom general election

response: *Florence Paton (1891–1976), Labour Party politician in the UK, Member of Parliament from 1945 to 1950
His second wife Florence Paton was MP for Rushcliffe from 1945 to 1950.
*Florence Paton – lay preacher, British Labour party

Widdowson unsuccessfully contested the Rushcliffe constituency in Nottingham in 1929 and again in 1931, the later time under her married name of Florence Paton. She did stand in 1935, but finally won the Rushcliffe seat at the 1945 general election.
*Florence Paton (1891–1976) – Labour Party politician; MP from 1945 to 1950
